bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Herman Singer (1915-2001) was an editor of the New Leader from 1945-1950. He worked for Radio Free Europe (RFE) and was active in their alumni organization, the Society of International Broadcasters. He edited the publication East Europe in the 1960s and 1970s wrote on V. F. Calverton, proletarian literature and Socialist Party history, and reviewed books and films.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: 2 boxes of serials, containing bound volumes of the NY Call, and News From Behind the Iron Curtain (NBIC)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collection contains correspondence and documents relating to his work on Calverton, Socialist Party history, NY Call/SDF, the Newspaper Guild-Free Europe Unit, and Free Europe Guild News. Also included is correspondence with Bob Rindel, Sam Solon, Calverton and various editors and publishers.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright (and related rights to publicity and privacy) to materials in this collection created by Herman Singer are held by his daughter, Judith Singer Sam. Permission to publish or reproduce materials to which she holds copyright must be secured from the copyright holder. Please contact the Tamiment Library for assistance with contacting Judith Singer Sam.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Judith Singer Sam sent a gift of four cartons of the papers of Herman Singer containing materials related to his literary career and political activities, and his work for Radio Free Europe in 2002. The accession number associated with this gift is 2002.016. Singer Sam also send materials related to Bob Rindl, Sam Solon, and Calverton in 2005.
